oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Christmas carol chairman and son, circa 1940 December 04
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Mrs. Miller G. Kimbrough, chairman for the Fannie Battle Day Home Christmas Eve carol choirs, seen with her son, Miller, Jr., who is having "visions of sugar plums" as his mother reads "The Night Before Christmas." This photograph illustrated the newspaper article "Fannie Battle Workers Make Plans for Carol Singing: Chairmen for Christmas Eve Choirs Named," published in the 4 December 1940 issue of the Nashville Banner. Forms part of the Fannie Battle Day Home Records. 1 photograph : b & w ; 9 x 7 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Kimbrough, Miller G., Mrs.; Kimbrough, Miller G., b. ca. 1939
